title: Hey Junglers, let me explain to you why top laners are always so toxic (explaining; not excusing it)
body:
It’s because top lane is basically won or lost in champ select. If I have to first pick top, I am at a huge disadvantage. There are very few champions you can pick top that don’t have any bad match-ups: Aatrox and Irelia basically turn everything into a skill-match up, Tahm and Morde are OP and have numbers that need to be toned down and any ranged top is pretty much safe and free to scale. Most top laners do not play a collection of these champions, at best one or two. 

So what does that mean? As I stated, if you don’t pick one of these as first pick top then you basically lose at champ select. Top is a long lane, it’s easy to gank and it’s incredibly punishing to those champions in a disadvantaged match up: one mistake even with wave management can turn into a 30cs deficit. We have no control over this, it’s just the nature of the lane. It has pretty much always been like this (wasn’t always this oppressive but the overall theme remained true). It likely won’t change. We can argue about whether it should or shouldn’t be this way all we want, but the fact is that it is what it is.

So what does this have to do with junglers? Well to be totally honest, you are literally the only thing that can save us in bad match-ups. Seriously, in many of these match-ups if we don’t get help, we ARE GOING to feed. We don’t want to but that’s the nature of these match-ups. Do you think hugging that tower will save us? Lmao hell no. And honestly, we have to get experience. Farm would be lovely but many of us have learned that you’ll probably be stripped of that access, so at the least just be in range to get exp. But the problem is you can only really do that under tower. You can’t do it past the center of the lane, and if I’m in a bad match up pushed under tower, I am GOING to be dove - likely by their top and jungler. 

Where do you come into this equation? Honestly it’s simple: just be there. I do not expect you to win my lane for me (that would be nice though). I understand you likely realize it’s a bad match-up and if we get caught in a 2v2, we may not win. I understand you might want to focus on more feasible lanes to gank. I totally get that and honestly, I support it: I don’t want to give top a double kill either. And if for whatever reason you and the jungler vertical jungle for the first clear, I’ll play safe and try to not get ganked. But here’s the thing: I need you to be here at times. 

You don’t need to even gank necessarily. Just show pressure. Show the top laner you won’t let him 100% dictate the lane. Even if you can blow his flash that is huge. If he’s freezing against me, and i ask you to come top, I am basically asking you to help me break the freeze. I realize the situation probably isn’t gankable. If I’m getting dove and you’re in the area, just respond. I cannot tell you how many times I’ve been dove while my jungler is literally right there doing frog or krugs. I know, you’re going to tell me about how I don’t protect you in an early invade: that’s because I usually CANT. If I don’t have lane pressure and I’m at a disadvantage early, I literally can not afford to miss those minions. Missing that exp alone could put me at such a huge deficit, I would lose the lane off of that. And I’ve already explained what top is like. If you’re karthus vs a lee sin, you should probably be trying to start top side anyway so you can get bot/mid lane protection because they can afford to roam and miss some exp the way top laners cannot afford. So it’s not the same thing, because you give up farming that you can come right back to in order to save an ally being dove and probably turning the dice to your favor. So it’s win-win. 

Listen, I realize top laners are not perfect. But our lane depends so much on jungle pressure: you have no idea. It’s especially frustrating when their jungler pinches a tent in top lane and you don’t do anything at all. I get it if you don’t want to come top in that situation, but you HAVE to do something somewhere else because I’m literally going to feed at this point and you’ll be having a jungler and top laner on the enemy team fed. So even when we don’t get direct lane pressure from our jungler, our junglers lack of presence elsewhere still impacts us significantly.

It doesn’t excuse top laners for flaming you: that is totally unacceptable. And many of us top laners could do a much better job of asking for help clearly instead of spam pinging you in typical NA passive aggressiveness (btw that’s a great thing about LAN: they will straight up just say what they want even if they’re less skilled). And we also need to understand your circumstances better. But just understand, 90% of the time jungle influence literally decides our lane and if we are counter picked, we really don’t have a say in our lane and so we rely on you. In a sad twisted way, you are like our extended support. We wish it wasn’t like this baby-love, but it is. So help your local top laner out.

It depends. If you get a kill, chances are that your wave will start to push back against their tower. If they have TP, you want to shove this ASAP so it crashes into their tower and the wave resets. If you don’t, they can hold it and freeze it indefinitely - especially against a Nasus. And this can lead to denying you. If they don’t have TP, you can slow push it into tower, or just back but again it all depends on what the wave looks like. In general, the rule of thumb is to shove the wave into tower if the wave pattern shifts to pushing into their tower because you do NOT want them having the ability to stop the wave from crashing. So in short, I would say “it depends.”

I have been playing since season 1, and was a diamond player in season 3.

Here is my advice in the current meta:

Neither Aatrox or Irelia have a very high win rate and are only effective if they land all their abilities perfectly.

Perhaps your issue is that you are prioritizing these champions too much.

1) Ask your team to ban Tahm Kench and Mordekaiser. 
2) Allow Irelia and Aatrox into the game. 
3) Jax does well against Irelia becaue he can dodge her Q, and matches her attack speed. 
4) Jax does well against Aatrox because he can leap over his first Q, and just win auto attack trades while dodging minion agro with e, the timing with Jax stun and Aatrox 2nd and 3rd Q is often such that Aatrox will automatically be stunned if he lands his 3rd Q in rapid succession with his 2nd, assuming you used e to reduce the AOE dmg of the 2nd Aatrox Q after you leap over his first Q. 
5) With full items, Jax beats both of these champions in 1v1, and has better dmg on baron/rift. 
6) Irelia and Aatrox are dependent upon landing their abilities to be successful. If they ever miss you automatically win the trade. 
7) Jax with Dorans Shield Rejuv bead and Grasp can sustain against either of these champions and is far superior with a full item build. 
Trinity force and Titanic Hydra with Dorans shield lets you survive their burst. Once their burst is over they have no chance. 

If you don't want to pick Jax:

Renekton and Nasus have higher win-rate and are easier than both Aatrox or Irelia.

If a top laner is toxic it is because they feel like they got cheated or ripped off. 

This is usually because of champions with extreme unbalance in their design.

Tahm Kench shield almost doubles his combat max health as early as level one, this stat is far more unbalanced than anything I've seen in this game.


This would make any player rage. Like if a ADC got double AD when low on health. Making it impossible to all in. 


People in general don't get upset unless something is unfair or unbalanced. 

It is more to do with current champion design than anything else in my opinion.

Either way, Jax beats both the skill matchups you mentioned, and Renekton is fine against anyone that doesn't have hyper scaling.

If you are having problems with team not helping you, pick a champion that is difficult to gank, and ban the counters. 

Jax, Shen, Vlad, renekton are all difficult to gank.
Maybe make a checklist of who counters who and then look after pick ban to see who has had the most counters banned out and play that champion.

Top Laners often know the matchups they are playing better than their Jungler. Therefore a Top laner knows when he needs a gank in order to win the lane, or stop an opponent from reaching a certain power curve. 

For example. If Jax reaches an item threshold that allows him to win 1v1 and sustain while pushing the lane, he becomes very difficult to beat. Jax needs to be slowed down and prevented from reaching that power curve. (A good item early ensures farm and kills which gives other good items later on ie power curve, miss the good item because of lack of farm early and certain items are often purchased later on or behind the curve. A jungler should be trying to put laners behind the curve, specifically the ones with the best item build path or one that scales the best with their abilities.)

Another (Better) Example: Nasus needs CDR to farm Q. If nasus can be forced to buy defensive items instead of CDR this prevents him from stacking effectively. Therefore pressuring Nasus at a certain point in the game is very effective. But once the Nasus reaches a certain power, Ganking him is no longer effective, and a jungler should focus on getting the champions strong that can kill nasus later in the game. 

Summary: Ganking at certain times during the game can be far more or far less effective. If a Jungler does not listen to the Top laner when he says, you need to gank right now or we lose the game, or does not listen when top pings the jungler to fall back from the lane, that might be a good reason for the top laner to be upset or become "Toxic" because the top laner recognized a win condition that the Jungler was not able or not willing to act on.

Top lane is by far the easiest lane to snowball for a jungler.

If I jg, I will 90% of the time camp top unless I notice early my top laner is garbage and will do nothing with a lead.

Top lane snowballs because if you gain a single xp advantage or kill advantage (xp+gold), you automatically win lane because all you need is one kill to be one item ahead of your opponent and you will always level up first to threaten an all-in.

What this does is completely starve the enemy top laner of CS since in order to last hit, he needs to get in engagement range of his opponent, unlike mid or bot lane who can at the very least farm melee minions from range without heavy risk of death.

Moreover, most top laners don't have enough survival or mobility to survive a 2v1 gank.

Meanwhile mid lane is a way shorter run to the safety of a turret and it's harder to catch mages overextended, while assassins generally have better mobility than bruisers (try to gank a Zed or Katarina or Fizz with their abilities up, way harder than ganking an Illaoi or Darius).

Bot lane meanwhile has a ranged champ, of which many of the meta ADC's have self peeling tools (Sivir a spell shield, Xayah her root, Vayne her tumbles, Lucian his dashes, Ezreal his blink, Jinx her traps). And on top of that, they may have a Rakan or Pyke or Morgana or Karma to stun/root/slow your ass off the enemy ADC.

There's no easier lane to gank than top lane, period.

Thus, obviously top laners feel the impact of jungler presence/absence far more.

Thing is, most junglers are kinda bound in according with the respawn timers of their camps.

So there are only a few minutes here or there that they will actually be around,,......which is what most toplaners seem kinda unable to understand.
